title: 02 ‚Ä¢ Hello World
summary: Write your first TypeScript game code with entities, components, and rendering.

content.text: In this tutorial, you'll create your first Nostalgi2D game from scratch. You'll learn how to initialize the engine, create actors with components, implement a game loop, and render to the screen.
Project Setup
Create a new TypeScript project and install the Nostalgi2D engine:

content.code:
mkdir my-game
cd my-game
npm init -y
npm install typescript @nostalgi2d/engine
npx tsc --init

Creating the HTML Canvas
Create an index.html file to host your game:

content.code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
  <title>My Nostalgi2D Game</title>
  <style>
    body {
      margin: 0;
      padding: 0;
      display: flex;
      justify-content: center;
      align-items: center;
      height: 100vh;
      background: #0a0e1a;
    }
    #game-canvas {
      border: 2px solid #08f7fe;
      box-shadow: 0 0 20px rgba(8, 247, 254, 0.5);
    }
  </style>
</head>
<body>
  <canvas id="game-canvas" width="800" height="600"></canvas>
  <script type="module" src="./src/main.ts"></script>
</body>
</html>
